name: Nikhil Sivadas
title: Ph.D Student, Department of Physics, Carnegie Mellon University
summary: My research interest lies in theoretical and computational condensed matter physics, in particular on the applications of Density Functional Theory (DFT) in understanding the electronic structure of materials. Over the last two years I have been using first principles techniques in understanding the electronic and thermodynamic properties of perovskite surfaces and interfaces. My work primarily focused on the role of polar catastrophe and oxygen vacancies in the origin of novel physics in these systems. I am also interested in van der Waals structure like transition metal dichalcogenide, boron nitride and graphene. Currently, my research efforts are directed towards understanding and predicting novel material properties (transport, magnetism, non-trivial topology).

name: Mahesh Ramachandran
title: Software Engineer at Google
summary: I'm currently working at Google on Machine learning applications for making smartphones smarter and more useful. Prior to this, I was at Qualcomm's Research division, inventing and prototyping novel mobile vision systems as well as helping to commercialize CV technology for several application domains on mobile devices. Through primary contributions as well as collaborations, I have built cutting-edge systems for 3D reconstruction, camera tracking in small areas, visual-inertial odometry, and object detection/recognition. I was primarily responsible for developing the CV algorithms for Qualcomm's mobile Visual-SLAM system, which delivers impressively smooth and robust camera tracking at 30Hz frame-rate. The system has been demonstrated on commercial mobile devices (smartphones and tablets) at various international conferences and trade shows. www.youtube.com/watch?v=831aBui9sMw www.youtube.com/watch?v=T70hgNvpUxE Played a key role in developing the visual-inertial tracking system for navigation and odometry applications. My diverse inventions in mobile technologies have resulted in 20+ patent applications filed with the USPTO and at international jurisdictions. Expertise and research interests span several areas in Computer Vision such as 3D vision, structure from motion, inertial sensor fusion, object/camera tracking, SLAM, video stabilization, multi-view video coding, image registration, face recognition etc. Additionally, competencies in machine learning, pattern recognition, and optimization theory.

groups.name: Stanford BUS-217: Getting from an Early Idea to a Real Business

past_companies.title: Staff Systems Engineer
past_companies.description: Promoted to a position of higher responsibility in March 2013 in recognition of excellent performance and technical leadership. Leading R&D efforts in real-time Computer Vision. - Working on projects in real-time computer vision on mobile platforms, with a focus on the augmented reality application domain. Designed and developed mobile vision systems for Visual SLAM, visual-inertial odometry, keypoint recognition, target detection and tracking, etc. My work has been commercialized into Qualcomm's two main commercial mobile-vision products: Vuforia Augmented Reality SDK and FastCV mobile-optimized library; research has resulted in 20+ invention disclosures to date filed with the USPTO and at international jurisdictions, with patents pending. - Serving additional roles as organizer of Computer Vision interest group (coordinating talks and discussions, mentoring interns on exploratory projects); coordinator of the University Relations program (engaging with faculty in top schools to pursue collaborations to develop next-generation technologies); member of recruitment panel; - Tech lead responsible for development and testing of the Visual SLAM solution (led a team of software and test engineers to develop various computer vision blocks of the system); on-site manager for major technology demonstrations and exhibits of my team's work at prestigious international conferences including CVPR, ISMAR; Gave the keynote talk at CVPR 2013 workshop on my team's work on mobile vision systems. - Published novel contributions to the SLAM system at ISMAR 2013 conference; Published three papers on Visual SLAM and Visual-Inertial odometry system at QTech (Qualcomm-wide technical conference); Won the best paper award for the Visual-SLAM system paper; Awarded the Qualcomm Star award for excellence in innovation and execution;

name: Karthik Venkatachalam
title: Scientist @ Pfizer Inc.
summary: As project lead my responsibilities include managing 3-6 scientists, analytical method development, troubleshooting scale-up issues, method validation and method transfers. Write analytical test methods, protocols and reports for method development, validation, transfers in compliance with cGLP, cGMP, FDA and ICH guidelines. Review technical package from API vendors and identify any issues associated with the test methods and validations. Further verify these drug substance methods and identify any issues in the methods so that a smooth method transfer occurs to the CMO’s. Draft drug product specifications and provide justifications for these specifications. Create custom fields using Waters Empower-2. Support product development team, which includes stability studies including ICH Light exposure, admixture studies, component compatibility studies, Reference listed drug evaluation. Develop and validate methods for both small and large molecule products. Develop methods for challenging products like nano suspensions, emulsions, ophthalmic suspensions, peptide drugs and lyophilized liposomal drug products. Use sound scientific knowledge to resolve critical issues related to method development, scale-up and transfer. Support regulatory affairs in providing sound scientific justifications for the deficiency’s issued by FDA for IND, NDA and ANDA. Periodically conduct meeting with our CMO’s to update the status on the projects. Train new hires in instrumentation, method development and validations. Co-ordinate with CRL’s for obtaining reports of out-sourced testing. Report directly to the Senior Director on a weekly basis about the update of the projects. Coordinate with the project planning and legal attorneys to finalize the CDA associated with our CRL and CMO’s. Travel offsite to the CROs/CMO’s to successfully transfer methods and trouble shoot any method related issues. Aid in recruitment of new hires.

past_companies.title: Asst. Procurement Manager
past_companies.description: • Developing and implementing purchasing and subcontract management instructions, policies, and procedures. • Administering the preparation of bids by securing credible subcontract bids and assurance of supplier’s commitment to prices, technical specifications, conditions, quality requirements and delivery to complete the company’s final bid to clients. • Reviewing tenders and bids with Procurement Manager and concerned departments to evaluate the suitability of the bids. • Create and maintain mutually beneficial long term partnerships with suppliers to foster feedback and continuous improvement by means of visiting the plant, distribution centers/showrooms and inspect their products or services and eventually carry out an assessment of their capabilities. • Implement appropriate sourcing strategies to control the company’s purchased material costs by means of emphasizing team buying principles through an active coordination within the company department Heads/project Managers and assuring them of an adequate source of supply. • Developing of corporate and departmental procedures with the aim of maintain quality status in accordance with ISO 9001:2008. Ensure the procurement process is implemented as per approved procedures. • Develop and maintenance of ‘approved suppliers list’. Approval and selection of prospective supplier to include in the company’s supply chain and vendor’s database. • Manage interfaces between project and procurement. Create integrated processes among operations, logistics, purchasing and outside suppliers to execute the planning and replenishment process. • Liaise with Engineering and Quality departments to ensure the technical and quality aspects. • Train and educate subordinates and associates about the procurement process control.

past_companies.title: Sr Procurement Supervisor
past_companies.description: About the Company :- One of the main pipe line contractors for Aramco with 36 years in executing turnkey projects of major pipeline projects for Saudi Aramco. Among the contracts completed are construction of over 3,000 kilometers of cross-country pipelines, trunk lines, flow lines, water injection lines, wellheads, cathodic protection systems, tie-ins, electrical and instrumentation, maintenance, rehabilitation and related civil works. Metals Services Company has executed projects, including pipelines up to 48” diameter. Job Profile :- • In-charge of the department in the absence of Procurement Manager. • Liaise with clients and vendors on matters relating to project procurement. • Reviewing requisitions and technical procurement specifications, purchase material packages and purchase orders. Identification of possible sources of supply and development of inquiry packages. • Negotiate with vendors, review and analyze bids. Development and placement of Purchase Orders/Service Agreements and follow the quote process in finalizing the agreements. • Supervision of the expediting reports in conformity with project construction schedule. • Ongoing assessment of the supplier’s performance and filling of all procurement related documents. • Direct and take an active part in solving problems and concerns involving the supplier and the dept/project that requires the materials. • Provision of weekly status report, expenditure forecast, KPI and carry out evaluation for any appropriate action. • Supervise new associates and help out in the team buying principle/negotiation. • Played an active role in developing the procedure for ISO Quality Management System.

past_companies.title: Procurement Supervisor

Job Profile :- • Execute direct procurement and purchasing functions such as raw materials, spares, machine. • Execute indirect procurement and purchasing functions of goods, commodities and services such as facilities renovation, IT, Maintenance, etc. • Analyzing market and delivery systems to assess present and future material availability. • Developed and implemented purchasing and contract management instructions, policies, and procedures.

name: Hemanth Siriki
title: Doctoral Candidate at California Institute of Technology
summary: I am a doctoral candidate in the Civil Engineering department at the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena, California. I work with earthquake engineering simulation group under the guidance of Dr. Swaminathan Krishnan at Caltech who conducts analytical research in the areas of earthquake engineering, structural dynamics, seismology, and computational mechanics, using high-performance computing. The focus of my research is to develop algorithms for generating stochastic seismic source models using historic and laboratory earthquake data. Currently, my work emphasizes on understanding the ground motion characteristics of large earthquakes in Southern California and on conducting design and probabilistic seismic hazard analysis for tall steel structures. The end goal is to unify computational seismology and earthquake engineering in the form of rupture-to-rafters simulations for robust earthquake damage prediction, preparation, mitigation, and disaster response.

summary: Mr. Agarwal have over 9.5 years consulting experience in coastal engineering and is proficient in performing sophisticated analytical and numerical analysis on a variety of meteorological and oceanographic data types. Mr. Agarwal’s work experience has ranged from writing his own computer codes and using available numerical models to performing modeling and analysis of wave transformation, tide and wind induced currents, wave-structure interaction, propeller wash, sediment transport, shoreline morphodynamics, and passing vessel hydrodynamics. As a Senior Coastal Engineer / Project Manager, Mr. Agarwal manages projects and guides the engineers and technicians on analysis and development of plans and drawings. He have participated in planning and data collection efforts, alternatives analyses, and assisted in determining design parameters for a variety of coastal design work including ports, marinas, and shoreline stabilization projects. Additionally, Mr. Agarwal have developed detailed scopes of work, reviewed billing reports to ensure projects are executed on time and within budget, prepared technical reports summarizing analyses done and recommendation to the clients and participated in client meetings and presentations.

name: Hari Bharadwaj
title: Research Fellow at The MGH/HST Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging
summary: I am currently a Research Fellow at the Athinoula A. Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH; Charlestown, MA). I recently finished my PhD in Biomedical Engineering at the Auditory Neuroscience Laboratory, Center for Computation Neuroscience and Neural Technology at Boston University, (Boston, MA). My recent efforts have been focused on investigating the mechanisms of various aspects of auditory perception using behavioural experiments, computational modeling, and neuroimaging techniques such as MEG, EEG and fMRI. In particular, I am interested in how we are able to effortlessly attend to a sound source of interest amidst noise in everyday adverse settings where even the state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms perform poorly (i.e., the cocktail-party problem). I am also interested in computational modeling of neural processes at a wide range of spatial scales to obtain further insight into the same and to develop better strategies to help hearing impaired listeners and to improve machine hearing. Broader interests include probabilistic modeling, dynamical Systems, signal processing, systems neuroscience and quantitative finance.

past_companies.title: Research Assistant
past_companies.company: Auditory Neuroscience Lab, Biomedical Engineering, Boston University
past_companies.description: Studied auditory attention and the peripheral, subcortical and cortical factors that determine performance in complex selective attention tasks at the individual level. Tools used are psychophysical behavioral experiments in combination with electrophysiological imaging methods including EEG, MEG and Auditory Brainstem Responses. Further insight is obtained using a systems approach to computational modeling primarily of the auditory periphery.

name: Deepak Pandey
title: Account Manager at Orchid Orthopedic Solutions
summary: My experiment with life has brought me to a point where I feel good about my choices. Would I do the same if I had to do it again … the answer is YES! My journey started when I boarded the British Air flight on August 3, 2003 from New Delhi (India) to Indianapolis (USA). It was an overwhelming beginning. I was coming to a country that I had only seen on the world map. I was uncertain about what and who I would become, but I was determined to significantly contribute to my field of study, which at that time was Physics. My first assignment after I entered the Physics Department at Purdue University was to teach an undergraduate physics lab to American students who were fresh out of high schools from all over Indiana. It was not the best first day for me – I was a fresh graduate from India with little experience in addressing an English speaking audience. However, I later realized that it was one of the most significant days of my life as this was the moment that opened the door to endless opportunities by giving me a confidence boost, which has stayed with me since. Science has always excited me and the pursuit of science to understand unknown scientific phenomenon has been very rewarding. It has given me an opportunity to be a contributing member of the scientific community. Teaching also appealed to me and it gave me the greatest thrill and feeling of accomplishment to see my students apply their skills to understand basic and complicated physical phenomena. For the next six years (2003-2009) I accomplished various landmarks in research (under the mentorship of my advisors Prof. Ronanld G. Reifenberger & Prof. Yong Chen) by publishing various scientific papers in journals like Nature Nanotechnology, Applied Physics Letters, Surface Science, Langmuir etc., with approximately 730 citations and 5 i10-index till date. -- To Continue Follow The Link --

name: Basanta Bhaduri
title: Research Associate at BIL, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
summary: Dr. Basanta Bhaduri is a postdoctoral research associate at the Biophotonics Imaging Lab (BIL), Beckman Institute for Advanced Science and Technology, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He has received the B.Tech. and M.Tech. in Optics and Opto-electronics from Calcutta University, India. He also received B.Sc. in Physics from Calcutta University. He obtained his PhD in Physics (Applied Optics) in 2007 from Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India. He was a postdoctoral research fellow in the Dept. of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, Monash University, Australia for 1 year and in the Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, National University of Singapore for 2 years. Before joining UIUC in June, 2011, he was working as an Assistant Professor in the Dept. of Physics, Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST), Trivandrum, India. He has published more than 70 papers in international journals and conferences and contributed a book chapter. He is a full member of Sigma Xi, the Scientific Research Society.

name: Bala Chandrasekaran
title: Director Client Services at Automation Anywhere
summary: Bala brings a unique blend of sales, product and technical expertise to bridge the gap between commercial and operational teams. He has extensive experience in both strategic and tactical areas of the technology business. Bala is currently freelancing with a few startups. Prior to this, Bala was VP of Global Client Services at Kyte, where he was responsible for pre-sales engineering, post-sale implementation, customer support and training, contributing 25% of total revenue. name: Baiju Alexander
title: Consultant at Ericsson
summary: SUMMARY It has been a splendid 8+ years in the telecommunication industry where in I have enjoyed my work with wide range of challenging tasks in the embedded real-time domain. I started with work at IC and SR as a Project officer implementing software modules for GSM Base station on DSP processors, this project also gave me an opportunity to understand how a complete GSM system works. My main contributions were development of UL and DL RF frontend chain, buffer handling and synchronization. After that I joined SAIT for LTE software development. Where I worked on developing a LTE simulator. This work also involved interface with L23. Then I moved on to help Wavesat develop their LTE chipset. I took up the ownership of Open loop Channel Quality indicator module. My contribution included converting details from 3GPP specs to design document, designing interface with upper layers for CQI module, implementing modules on a multicore DSP platform and testing. Later I joined Ericsson for Testbed development where I could work with HETNET and Multiantenna Beamforming. In recent years I have worked in the physical layer domain of LTE Modem at ST-Ericsson and Ericsson. As part of the team I was involved in realization of Measurement and Cell search features. I also worked on power save feature for the modem. Apart from feature development I took keen interest in crash analysis and debugging. I also got opportunity to participate and fix critical customer issues during field trials. Specialties: LTE, LTE PHY, LTE Layer 1 , Layer 1, HETNET, assembly language, bsc, bts, c, debugging, features, gps, gsm, lte, linux, macintosh, matlab, microsoft windows, modems, msc, networking, oil painting, operating systems, programming, protocols, radio, research, simulation, sms, software development, software testing, system architecture, telecommunications,

name: Arun Kumar
title: Graduate Student at The University of Wisconsin-Madison
summary: Arun Kumar is a PhD candidate in the Department of Computer Sciences at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, from where he obtained his Masters in Computer Sciences in 2011. He obtained his Bachelors in Computer Science and Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras in 2009. He is co-advised by professors Jeffrey Naughton and Jignesh Patel, and he is a research assistant at the Microsoft Jim Gray Systems Lab, which is headed by emeritus professor David DeWitt. He also collaborates with professors Steve Wright and Jerry Zhu as well as with Microsoft. Previously, he worked with professor Christopher Ré. Systems and ideas based on his research have been released as part of the MADlib open-source library, and shipped as part of products from Oracle, IBM, EMC, and Cloudera. A paper co-authored by him was accorded the Best Paper Award at ACM SIGMOD 2014. He was awarded the Anthony C. Klug NCR Fellowship in database systems in 2015. He has interned at Microsoft Cloud and Information Services Lab, Oracle, and IBM Research. Homepage: http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~arun/

name: Arnab Mukherjee
title: Boswell Postdoctoral Fellow
summary: My research interest lies in engineering proteins (e.g. photoreceptors, enzymes, signaling molecules) to develop new tools for molecular imaging. In my PhD at Illinois, I engineered algal and bacterial photoreceptors to develop fluorescent proteins for biological imaging in low-oxygen (hypoxic) conditions. As a postdoctoral fellow at Caltech, I am currently engineering metalo-proteins to develop viable contrast agents for functional magnetic resonance imaging. In addition, I am actively interested in developing molecular-scale tools for integrated imaging and therapeutics (in the context of photodynamic therapy), photoacoustic imaging, as well as fluorescent sensors that can function in an oxygen-independent manner.

past_companies.description: Intelligent Alarm Systems (IAS) on Continuous Pharmaceutical Manufacturing My research area is multidisciplinary in nature, combining process systems engineering methodologies and pharmaceutical engineering-based models and sensing methods, and is being carried out in collaboration with researchers at three other universities. The objective is to develop a comprehensive framework which can detect and diagnose abnormal events and either provide mitigation advice to a human operator or automate mitigation strategies. The research addresses one of the important challenges in effective real time process management; i.e., the implementation of intelligent systems that can assist human operators in making supervisory control decisions, instead of simply sounding an alarm when process variables go out of range. • Collaborated with researchers from four universities and mentors from industries and was core member of the team that bulit the pilot plant for continuous pharmaceutical manufacturing • Developed IAS framework incorporating multi-layered plant wide control consisting of 1) Regulatory control – local PID control loops, 2) Supervisory control – plant-wide MPC 3) Exceptional event module (EEM) for the pilot plant • IAS provided real time monitoring of pilot scale plant and took corrective actions based on the process conditioning model • EEM module consisting of Wavelet Analysis (WA), Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Signed Directed Graph (SDG) and Qualitative Trend Analysis (QTA), executed real-time detection, diagnosis and mitigation of exceptional events • Identified Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs) and Critical Process Parameters (CPPs) and devised experimental set-ups for online measurements of these variables using multiple sensing schemes including NIR, microwave and imaging Adviser: Prof. G. V. Reklaitis and Prof. V. Venkatasubramanian

name: Abhishek Sheshadri
title: Graduate Student at Stanford University
summary: "The mathematician does not study pure mathematics because it is useful; he studies it because he delights in it and he delights in it because it is beautiful" - J.H Poincare I've loved and admired the beauty of mathematics from a very young age. Today that passion for math still stands unabated in me. I work on research projects in various fields, but all of them are ultimately tributaries of applied and computational mathematics. My doctoral research is in the field of Computational Fluid Dynamics, where I work on developing high-order numerical techniques for solving non-linear hyperbolic PDEs. Over the past couple of years, I have developed a fascination for financial mathematics. Finance is a system run by humans - so unlike natural phenomena, the more we understand about this system, the more complicated it gets! I am currently working on a research project in the field of Peer-to-peer lending. I've also had great fun working on other team projects for project classes in investment science and statistical finance. Today, the development of algorithms is no longer a pure mathematics job. The architecture the algorithm is developed for dictates the structural core of the algorithms. During my intern at Robert Bosch, I worked on developing efficient linear algebra algorithms for a multi-CPU-GPU platform. I am also one of the developers of the open-source mixed platform CFD package HiFiLES. My dream is to help scientific and technological advancement through computational research. If you'd like to discuss math, aircrafts/rockets, war, technology, poker, chess, football or Youtube videos, feel free to contact me! Specialties: - Math: Linear Algebra, PDEs, SDEs, Optimization - Familiar with efficient programming for mixed computing platforms - Machine Learning and Data Mining - C/C++, MATLAB, R
